title: FBI: William Claude "Claudel" Ashe

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Bureau records related to one William Claude L Ashe. Ashe (Born September 28th 1925 in South Point, South Carolina - died April 9th 1995 in Alamance, North Carolina) was known to the bureau by numerous aliases, including:

Claud Ash
Oscar Claude L. Ashe
William Claudell Ashe
William Claudel Ashe
David Lee Daniel 
David Lee Daniels 

According to the Social Security Death Index, Ashe had a social security number of: 240307664
According to Volume 28 of FBI's Law Enforcement Bulletin, Ashe had an "FBI Number" of: FBI Number: 2,447,337

According to Volume 28 of the FBI's Law Enforcement Bulletin, Ashe was serving a life sentence for a 1948 shotgun murder in North Carolina, when he escaped prison. Ashe was then a fugitive from justice from September 19th 1955 until he was arrested by agents of the bureau in June 1959 in Punta Gorda, Florida. 

https://www.google.ge/books/edition/FBI_Law_Enforcement_Bulletin/Rv-NMS9zpfUC?hl=en&gbpv=1&dq=William%20Claude%20Ashe&pg=RA3-PP1&printsec=frontcover

This is a request for records about William Claudell Ashe from any and all FBI offices, including HQ, field offices, legal attaches, and facilities that maintain records under the FBI’s control. Please conduct a search for any records on Ashe held by the Tampa and Charlotte field offices. According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a physical search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for any records or documents related to William Claudel Ashe. 

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to William Claudel Ashe. 

If the bureau cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Bonnie Campbell

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Bonnie Campbell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 29, 2024
Location: Tulsa, OK (Airport)
Suspect: Bonnie Campbell, 53
Incident Summary:
Bonnie Campbell was arrested for allegedly driving under the influence (DUI) on an airport runway. Air traffic control reported that she was blocking the runway and driving around it. Officers arrived and took her into custody, during which she admitted to drinking prior to and while parked at the airport. Officers also noted that this was the second consecutive day they had received reports of her driving under the influence at the airport.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the DUI call at the airport.
Interacted with and questioned Campbell.
Placed Campbell under arrest and transported her.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Breakout Activities

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Breakout Activities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, including correspondence, for the 2023 - 2024 and 2024 to date showing coordination to set the dates for "Breakout" each year to include, without limitation, those related to scheduling Breakout one or more years in advance to accomidate the NCAA Schedule and any athletic calendars produced and distributed to NCAA athletes showing the date of the scheduled Breakout Activities and communicating with affiliated athletic conferences to schedule events. Records of scheduling Breakout well in advance (up to 2 years) are known to exist as well as NCAA schedules given to at least some NCAA teams and/or players at the start of each year showing when these events are scheduled.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: November 6, 2024
Location: Hartford, CT
Suspect: Gisselle Victoria-Gonzalez, 42
Incident Summary:
Victoria-Gonzalez was arrested in Hartford on a warrant for second-degree murder in Florida regarding the disappearance of her roommate, Runyleidy Medina-Pacheco. Authorities in Orlando allege she falsely reported Medina-Pacheco missing in December 2022, and subsequent investigation uncovered evidence of a violent incident at their residence. The bodycam footage reportedly captures officers processing Victoria-Gonzalez and communicating with her through a Spanish translator.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Participated in the arrest of Victoria-Gonzalez.
Processed her at the time of arrest.
Interacted with her using a translator.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Traffic Stop – Trenton Futrell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: April 18, 2024
Suspect: Trenton Futrell
Incident Summary:
Futrell was pulled over for allegedly speeding 10 mph over the limit. After stopping in his driveway, he engaged in a profanity-laced tirade against the responding officer, refusing to provide his driver’s license and becoming increasingly aggressive. The officer called for backup, and after continued noncompliance, Futrell was arrested for resisting arrest. He was transported to jail and later released on bond.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:
Conducted the initial traffic stop.
Responded as backup to the scene.
Were involved in Futrell’s arrest and transport to jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: January 17
Location: Walmart, 1501 E 29th Street, Muncie, IN
Suspect: Shamesha Hendrix, 36
Victim: [Victim's name if available] and her infant child
Incident Summary:
Hendrix allegedly confronted the victim in the Walmart parking lot, insulted her child, and forcefully grabbed the baby seat from the shopping cart. She then allegedly threw the baby seat back into the cart, causing concern for the infant’s safety. Paramedics were called to check on the child. Hendrix fled the scene before officers arrived but was later arrested on February 15, 2024, and charged with battery of a person under the age of 14.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the Walmart incident on January 17

Were involved in Hendrix’s arrest on February 15

title: Memphis FRS

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Memphis FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – Sergio Nino
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: January 23, 2024
Suspect: Sergio Nino, 16 (at the time of the incident)
Incident Summary:
Officers Kristofer Gries, Blake Willer, and Matthew Smith responded to a call from Nino’s father regarding a family dispute. Bodycam footage reportedly captures officers encouraging Nino’s father to physically discipline him, dismissing allegations of abuse, and making statements such as "Your dad should beat you" and "You have no rights." A confrontation ensued when Officer Willer attempted to take Nino’s phone, resulting in officers using force against him. Nino suffered a broken wrist, facial lacerations requiring stitches, and was subsequently hospitalized. He was charged with aggravated assault, though charges were later dropped.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Spoke with Sergio Nino’s father before engaging with the teenager.
Interacted with Sergio Nino, including advising his father on discipline.
Used force on Nino, leading to his injuries and subsequent arrest.
Transported Nino from the scene to medical facilities or booking.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Nichole Maks

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Nichole Maks
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: July 1, 2023
Location: 600 block of Clark Street, Daytona Beach, FL
Suspect: Nichole Maks, 37
Incident Summary:
Nichole Maks was arrested for the murder of her 79-year-old roommate, Michael Cerasoli. Authorities responded to a fire at the residence, where Cerasoli was found deceased with blunt force trauma and multiple stab wounds. Maks was later located at a restaurant in Holly Hill, where she was found with blood on her clothing and in possession of a knife and hammer. During her post-Miranda interview, she attempted to destroy potential evidence by pouring Diet Mountain Dew on herself. She was charged with second-degree murder, resisting arrest with violence, arson, and tampering with physical evidence.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

First made contact with Nichole Maks.
Took her into custody at the restaurant in Holly Hill.
Transported her to the station and recorded her post-Miranda interview.
Were involved in securing evidence and handling the tampering incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Major George Drafts

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest – Major George Drafts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
ocation: Myrtle Beach, SC
Suspect: Major George Drafts
Incident Summary:
A major in the Columbia Police Department (CPD) was arrested Thursday night.
Columbia Police confirmed that Major George Drafts was arrested and charged with driving under the influence and transporting in a vehicle with a broken seal by Myrtle Beach police officers.
Per CPD protocol, Drafts has been suspended without pay pending an internal investigation.
According to police, Drafts was released on bond early Friday morning.

I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:
Conducted the traffic stop and field sobriety tests.
Arrested and transported Major George Drafts.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: FOIA Request – Police Funding & Surveillance Spending

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Police Funding & Surveillance Spending
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Budget & Spending on Law Enforcement
 - The full annual budget breakdown for the Flint Police Department over the last five years.
 - All federal, state, and private grants received by law enforcement agencies for policing and surveillance technology.
 - A full report on how civil asset forfeiture funds have been allocated and spent.
 - Any public records on contracts with private security, surveillance, or intelligence firms (Palantir, Flock Safety, Clearview AI, Axon, etc.).
 - Breakdown of spending on riot control and protest management tools, including:
	-Tear gas
	-LRADs (Long Range Acoustic Devices)
	-Rubber bullets & kinetic impact projectiles
	-Surveillance drones

Surveillance Technology & Intelligence Spending
 - All procurement records for facial recognition systems, predictive policing AI, and data analytics tools.
 - All contracts with third-party data brokers used by law enforcement.
 - Any records related to payments made to Flock Safety for license plate readers or other surveillance tools.
 - Documentation on public-private partnerships regarding law enforcement technology & AI-driven policing.

I request digital copies of these documents. If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific legal exemption being cited.

I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michigan Transparency

title: FOIA Request – Surveillance & Riot Control Equipment

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Surveillance & Riot Control Equipment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Statewide Surveillance & Intelligence Sharing
 - All deployment logs and internal policies related to the use of Stingray (cell-site simulator) technology in the last five years.
 - All statewide License Plate Reader (LPR) data retention policies and agency access logs.
 - Copies of any agreements with the FBI, DHS, or other federal agencies regarding data sharing of facial recognition and predictive policing technology.
 - Any contracts, policies, or usage records for predictive policing algorithms used by the Michigan State Police.
 - Any records on the use of AI and machine learning tools for social media and online tracking.

Riot Control & Military Equipment
 - Full inventory of crowd control weapons owned by the Michigan State Police (including tear gas, LRADs, rubber bullets, and drones).
 - Deployment records for military-grade vehicles (MRAPs, BearCats, etc.) for civilian policing.
 - Internal training manuals and policies regarding handling protests, civil unrest, and mass demonstrations.
 - Any documentation on the use of undercover agents or confidential informants in activist groups.

Budget & Procurement
 - All contracts and purchase orders for surveillance technology providers (e.g., Palantir, Clearview AI, ShotSpotter, Flock Safety).
 - A full breakdown of grants and federal funding received for law enforcement surveillance in the last five years.
 - A copy of any budget reports detailing money allocated to counter-terrorism or domestic security operations.


I request digital copies of these documents. If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific legal exemption being cited.

I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest.

Please confirm receipt of this request and respond within 5 business days, as required by Michigan FOIA law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michigan Transparency

Budget & Equipment Acquisition
 - A full breakdown of grants, federal funding, and private donations received for police surveillance and riot control equipment.
 - A report on how funds from civil asset forfeiture have been spent in the last five years.
 - Any contracts with private surveillance companies (e.g., Palantir, Flock Safety, Clearview AI, Axon).

title: Untitled (Department Of Justice, Office Of The Deputy Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled (Department Of Justice, Office Of The Deputy Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Greetings. I request copies of any memos, studies, or other such records dated Jan 1, 2020, through the date you complete your search, referencing (1) the Justice Department resources spent or expected to be spent litigating Freedom of Information Act cases or (2) the frequency with which the government has won or lost Freedom of Information Act cases.  I'm not looking for individual emails that happen to make mention of these subjects, but rather, more formal studies or other such records that are the results of a more formal evaluation.  I'm happy to discuss the scope with you.  By "resources" I mean the costs in terms of attorney/staff hours, FTEs, or salaries.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

title: Request for DA Records on Due Process Violations and Informant Use

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for DA Records on Due Process Violations and Informant Use
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Case-Specific Records (Discovery & Prosecution Materials)

Complete case file related to the prosecution of Kayla Orsell in Gloversville City Court including:

All charging documents, warrants, and affidavits

Grand jury transcripts (if applicable)

Brady material (exculpatory evidence, required to be disclosed under Brady v. Maryland)

Giglio material (evidence that impeaches prosecution witnesses, including informants)

Rosario material (witness statements required under NY law)

All evidence logs and chain of custody records for physical evidence

All subpoenas issued in connection with your case

Internal communications between prosecutors regarding this case

Any orders or memos related to sealing or withholding evidence

Pursuant to New York Public Officers Law § 87 and the principles of government transparency, I request:

A complete financial audit of all payments made to confidential informants (CIs) by the District Attorney’s Office over the past five years.


Records of all disbursement logs, receipts, and financial transactions related to CI payments, including:

Payment amounts, dates, and approving officials.

The justification for each payment.

Policies governing the use and compensation of informants.

Internal audits or reviews of CI payment practices.


Records of any disciplinary actions or investigations related to the misuse or improper handling of CI funds.

These records are essential for assessing potential misuse of public funds and ensuring accountability in the use of informants in criminal prosecutions.

Prosecutorial Misconduct & Systemic Due Process Violations

Complaints or disciplinary actions against the prosecutor(s) involved in this case

Internal policies and training materials on prosecutorial conduct

All records of prior cases where the DA’s office was found to have withheld exculpatory evidence

Data on dismissed or overturned convictions due to prosecutorial misconduct

Communications between the DA’s office and the court regarding the case of Kayla Orsell in Gloversville City Courthouse 

Any notes, memos, or orders related to plea bargaining practices

Emails discussing Kayla Orsell’s case between the DA’s office and local law enforcement

Confidential Informants & Witness Handling

All agreements, communications, and payment records related to confidential informants (CIs) involved in Kayla Orsell’s case

Complete criminal history and cooperation agreements for any CIs who offered testimony or information against Kayla Orsell in her prosecution that took place in Gloversville City Court from 04/09/2024 to 01/18/2025

Training manuals and policies on the use of confidential informants

Any past lawsuits or internal complaints related to informant misconduct

Records showing whether informants were permitted to commit crimes while cooperating

Law Enforcement & Police Misconduct

All police reports and notes related to Kayla Orsell’s case

Internal affairs complaints and investigations into arresting officers

Body camera footage, dash cam footage, and 911 call records related to the arrest

Emails between the DA and Gloversville/Johnstown police about this case

List of all lawsuits filed against law enforcement officers involved in this case

Records of any investigations into missing evidence or tampering

Prior Civil Rights Violations & Lawsuits Against the DA’s Office

Complete list of civil rights lawsuits filed against the DA’s office in the past 10 years

All FOIA/FOIL requests previously denied by the DA’s office

Records of any settlements or judgments against the DA’s office for misconduct

Complaints, disciplinary records, and internal reviews of prosecutors in this case

Emails or memos discussing public records requests related to prosecutorial misconduct

Improper Handling of Kayla Orsell’s Legal Proceedings

Records showing why the City Court handled a felony case (jurisdictional issue)

List of cases where jurisdiction was improperly handled in a similar way

All communications between the DA and the presiding judge DiMezza in Kayla Orsell’s case

Records related to the assignment of Kayla Orsell’s attorneys

Memos or internal DA emails regarding denied transcript requests

FOIA/FOIL Non-Compliance & Cover-Ups

List of all FOIL requests submitted about Gloversville/Johnstown law enforcement

Records showing how many of these FOIL requests were ignored or denied

Policies on how the DA’s office handles FOIL requests

Emails or memos about handling public records requests related to misconduct

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Orsell

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: R151633-030225
communications.communication:
Dear Mahad Mohammed: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 3/2/2025 and given the reference number R151633-030225 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

title: UN AMB Arthur Goldberg June 6, 1967 Speech re: position of Sixth Fleet aircraft

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: UN AMB Arthur Goldberg June 6, 1967 Speech re: position of Sixth Fleet aircraft
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On June 6, 1967, at the United Nations prior to the conflict later to become known as the Six Day War, U.S. Ambassador Arthur Goldberg said to the Security Council that aircraft of the Sixth Fleet were several hundred miles from the conflict.

We are asking for a complete copy of the comments made by AMB Goldberg.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

title: Flock oversight and data sharing

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Flock oversight and data sharing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Oak Park Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

1.  All Flock related records delivered to the citizen police oversight body including, but not limited to the following:
1.1  Searches conducted by the department
1.2  Searches by outside agencies that included the department's Flock network
1.3  Flock Activity reports
1.4  Memos and other reports

2. Current data sharing that includes:
2.1  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
2.2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
2.3  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
2.4  The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

RTL

communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
 
 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut Office of Early Childhood received your Freedom of Information Act request on 3/3/2025. It was given the reference number R000011-030325 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act.

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest and Interrogation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: December 11, 2024
Location: Miami Beach, FL
Suspects: Alon Alexander, Oren Alexander
Incident Summary: The Alexander brothers were arrested by Miami Beach Police as part of a multi-state investigation into alleged sex trafficking and sexual assault. The bodycam footage reportedly captures their arrest and subsequent interrogations, with Oren Alexander being transported to a police vehicle before questioning began approximately 10 minutes later. A similar interrogation took place with Alon Alexander in a separate room. The total footage reportedly lasts nearly two hours.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Participated in the arrests of Alon and Oren Alexander.
Transported the suspects.
Conducted or were present during their interrogations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Fusion Reports

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Fusion Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear NC ISAAC,

I am submitting a public records request under North Carolina General Statutes (NCGS) § 132-1 for any intelligence bulletins, threat assessments, situational awareness reports, or law enforcement notifications issued by NC ISAAC between February 21, 2025, and February 28, 2025.

Specifically, I request:
	1.	Any general or region-specific intelligence reports issued during this period.
	2.	Any alerts or warnings shared with local law enforcement agencies related to public safety concerns.
	3.	Any internal memos or communications summarizing relevant intelligence within this timeframe.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide the specific statutory exemption under which the information is being withheld. Additionally, if redactions are required, I request that you provide the non-exempt portions of the records in accordance with state law.

Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience and provide an estimated timeline for fulfillment. If any fees are associated with processing, I would appreciate a cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your time and cooperation. I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alabama Times

title: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the 2022 A&E documentary series "Butchers of the Bayou." Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Butchers of the Bayou," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Butchers of the Bayou."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: All unedited bodycam videos and 911 calls for case BA490599

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: All unedited bodycam videos and 911 calls for case BA490599
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all unedited/unredacted (if possible) bodycam footage and 911 calls related to the case of Daystar Peterson (BA490599). Please include transcripts of the calls and bodycam footage if available. One particular call is of great public interest: the call from Sean Kelly, the only independent eyewitness in this case. The public has not heard that call, nor have we seen the transcript of it. Other calls from witnesses who were not eyewitnesses have been released publicly. I would also like the original police reports associated with the case as well.

The  incident took place around 4:30am on 07/12/2020 in the Hollywood Hills neighborhood.  Cross streets Nichols Canyon Rd and Courtney Avenue.

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dana T.
